intro: Hieracium amaurolepis, commonly known as the black-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are dark green and often have a velvety texture, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer. Hieracium amaurolepis is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
